news.title: Bright new star to burst into the sky in five years, astronomers predict
news.summary: A team of astronomers is making a bold forecast: A binary star found in the summer constellation Cygnus the swan will burst into a red nova sometime in 2022.

news.title: Binary star system might go nova in 2022
news.summary: Set a reminder to look up at the stars more in 2022. You might see a star explode.

news.title: Así será la explosión que podría cambiar el cielo en 2022

news.title: Mating stars hide their modesty behind a thick veil of dust
news.summary: NASA, ESA and H.E. Bond (STScI) Like most people, stars seem to prefer their privacy when getting it on.

news.title: A bright new star will burst into the sky in five years, astronomers predict

blogs.title: Evolution of the stellar-merger red nova V1309 Scorpii: SED analysis [SSA]
blogs.summary:
http://arxiv.org/abs/1606.09426



    One very important object for understanding the nature of red novae is V1309 Sco. Its pre-outburst observations showed that, before its red-nova eruption in 2008, it was a contact binary quickly evolving to the merger

blogs.title: Mating stars hide their modesty behind a thick veil of dust
blogs.summary: Astronomers got their best ever look at merging stars when a pair called V1309 Scorpii got together in 2008, but now they have gone into hiding

wikipedia.title: V1309 Scorpii
wikipedia.summary: V1309 Scorpii (also known as V1309 Sco) is a contact binary that merged into a single star and went nova in 2008 in a process known as a luminous red nova.
